IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO AID IN THE CREATION, SURVIVAL AND GROWTH OF COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH A BROAD RANGE OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, CONSULTING SERVICES, AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT. IHD IS AFFILIATED WITH THE ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK CATHOLIC HOMES, INC., WHICH PROVIDES OVERSIGHT TO ARCHDIOCESAN AFFILIATED HOUSING COMPANIES. THE ORGANIZATION IS ALSO AFFILIATED WITH THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE ARCHDIOCESE OF NEW YORK AND OTHER ARCHDIOCESAN ENTITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ASSURE THE MAINTENANCE AND DEVELOPMENT OF QUALITY AFFORDABLE HOUSING THROUGH MANAGEMENT AND OVERSIGHT SERVICES TO PARISH-SPONSORED HOUSING PROJECTS OWNED BY NON-PROFIT HOUSING DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCE COMPANIES. IHD ALSO MANAGES DEVELOPMENT OF NEW AFFORDABLE HOUSING UNITS ON VACANT OR UNDERUTILIZED PARISH PROPERTIES, AND THE REFINANCING OF EXISTING DEBT OBLIGATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES CONSULTING TO VARIOUS INDEPENDENT COMPANIES THAT MANAGE AFFORDABLE MULTIFAMILY AND SENIOR CITIZEN HOUSING. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO PROVIDES CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT CONSULTING AND DEVELOPMENT SERVICES TO HOUSING DEVELOPMENT FINANCE CORPORATIONS ENGAGED IN THE REHABILITATION OF EXISTING AFFORDABLE HOUSING PROJECTS AND CONSTRUCTION FOR NEW AFFORDABLE HOUSING.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: EDELMAN SULTAN KNOX WOOD ARCHITECTS LLP

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: INVESTMENT IN ARCHDIOCESAN COMMON INVESTMENT FUND

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IHD BELIEVES IT HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2022 IN ACCORDANCE WITH ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION (ASC) TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES, WHICH PROVIDES STANDARDS FOR ESTABLISHING AND CLASSIFYING ANY TAX PROVISIONS FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. IHD IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING JURISDICTIONS FOR PERIODS PRIOR TO 2020.
RECOVERY OF PRIOR YEAR REHABILITATION GRANTS 98,397.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MADE A GRANT TO A RELATED ORGANIZATION WITH A COMMON PURPOSE. THE ORGANIZATION MONITORED THE USE OF THE FUNDS THROUGH COMMON MANAGEMENT.

THE ORGANIZATION PAID MERIT-BASED DISCRETIONARY BONUSES DURING THE YEAR. THESE AMOUNTS WERE INCLUDED IN THE INDIVIDUAL'S REPORTABLE COMPENSATION AND ARE REFLECTED ON SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN (B)(II).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NYIHD HAS A BUSINESS SERVICES AGREEMENT WITH CATHOLIC CHARITIES COMMUNITY SERVICES UNDER WHICH CCCS PROVIDES FISCAL OPERATIONS SERVICES FOR WHICH IT CHARGED ANYCH $201,000 IN THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS A MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION WITH ONE MEMBER, THE ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK CATHOLIC HOMES, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION ELECTS THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOLLOWING GOVERNANCE DECISIONS ARE RESERVED TO THE MEMBER: 1) REMOVAL OF ANY DIRECTOR WITHOUT CAUSE 2) ANY AMENDMENT TO THE CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION, BY-LAWS OR MISSION STATEMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION 3) APPROVAL OF A PLAN OF MERGER OR CONSOLIDATION OF THE CORPORATION, OR DISSOLUTION OF THE CORPORATION 4) APPROVAL OF THE SALE, MORTGAGE, LEASE, EXCHANGE OR OTHER DISPOSITION OF ALL OR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF THE ASSETS OF THE CORPORATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO MEMBERS OF THE BOARD'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND THEN THE BOARD FOR REVIEW AND DISCUSSION AT THEIR RESPECTIVE MEETINGS PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WHICH COVERS ALL DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, COMMITTEE MEMBERS, PROFESSIONAL STAFF MEMBERS, AND OTHER EMPLOYEES ("INTERESTED PERSONS"). INTERESTED PERSONS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO ANY ACTION ON SUCH CONTRACT OR TRANSACTION. IF A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST WERE TO ARISE, THE INTERESTED PERSON MAY NOT VOTE ON THE RELATED TRANSACTION. ALL DISCUSSION AND DELIBERATION IS DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. THE BOARD IS RESPONSIBLE TO ENSURE THAT THE STATED PROCESS OCCURS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICY. ALL BOARD MEMBERS MUST ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT AND DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE COMPENSATION OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER ANNUALLY. THE ANNUAL BUDGET, INCLUDING COMPENSATION, IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND THEN RATIFIED BY THE FULL BOARD. ON AN ONGOING BASIS, COMPARABLE DATA FROM THIRD PARTIES IS USED BY THE ORGANIZATION TO KEEP COMPENSATION IN LINE WITH INDUSTRY STANDARDS. THE COMPENSATION DETERMINATION IS DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING. THE PROCESS WAS LAST CONDUCTED IN 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

OTHER PROFESSIONAL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 207,666. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 4,709. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 212,375. CLOSING FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 554,276. RECRUITMENT FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 0. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 38,295. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 38,295. PAYROLL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 1,400. THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
